page.title: 11VIOLIN MAKING IN HORTON
page.content: On Friday the 14th of June 1985 Mr Bonnet came to show us how he makes violins. Mr. Bonnet lives in Horton. First he shapes the frame using a mould to bend the thin wood.He carves the main piece out of Elm which he has seasoned.The strings are put on by someone that is a specialist. Mr Bonnet has been making violins for 12 years.It takes 140 hours to make one violin. The violin costs about Â£650, because it takes a lot of care to make one violin. Mr. Bonnet plays in a local folk music group. They play at barn dances all over Somerset.
